answers.answer: I had some bleeding/spottong that early, mine was due to my body pushing out my unused egg. But many women can have a full blown period during pregnancy. Dont worry too much unless its horribly painful, then go to the er. Hope that eases your mind a bit :)
Yeah I've heard that! My husband and I just wanted this little one so bad I'm just scared something bad is gonna happen even though the dr.s told me it's fine lol
Stress is bad for baby so I would try (I know, easier said than done) to relax as much as possible and keep positive.

I had spotting as well. It scared the living crap out of me and even though everything I read said it was normal , I rushed to the er. they did blood work and an ultrasound and gave me reassurance that everything was fine ! Just remember it's quite common, and unless you get painful cramps, or heavy bleeding, there's nothing to worry about. And try not to stress (:

I had spotting as well. question: Here's my story so far. Any insight is  appreciated!  I am exactly 5 weeks today and the whole time I have had spotting, not bleeding though.  Which i believe is caused by my occupation. I am currently thinking of quitting. Cramping about twice but nothing unbearable.  I have had many pregnancy symptoms,  including sore breasts and nipples, cravings,  nausea and vomiting,  frequent urination etc. My hcg levels rose but didn't double but the doctor said there was nothing to worry about.  Same with the spotting.  I have already been diagnosed with gestational diabetes.  I feel like my anxiety is through the roof because I feel like it's been such a scary road already and I'm only 5 weeks! The doctors reassure me that everything is fine and we'll just keep a close eye on the baby. I have my almost 8 weeks ultrasound on the 10th which will hopefully calm me down. But can anyone offer and advice, similar experience or reassurance?  Any thoughts are appreciated!!!
title: First time mom, so many questions? !
